title: argparse error when using an unknown flag with anvi-merge
body:
On Midway, using anvi-master, if you add a flag to `anvi-merge` that isn't a recognized flag, it gives this error instead of a friendly anvi'o error:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/alonshaiber/github/anvio/bin/anvi-merge", line 49, in <module>
    args = anvio.get_args(parser)
  File "/Users/alonshaiber/github/anvio/anvio/__init__.py", line 47, in get_args
    parser.add_argument(f, action='store_true')
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/3.7.3/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/argparse.py", line 1367, in add_argument
    return self._add_action(action)
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/3.7.3/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/argparse.py", line 1730, in _add_action
    self._optionals._add_action(action)
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/3.7.3/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/argparse.py", line 1571, in _add_action
    action = super(_ArgumentGroup, self)._add_action(action)
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/3.7.3/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/argparse.py", line 1381, in _add_action
    self._check_conflict(action)
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/3.7.3/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/argparse.py", line 1520, in _check_conflict
    conflict_handler(action, confl_optionals)
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/3.7.3/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/argparse.py", line 1529, in _handle_conflict_error
    raise ArgumentError(action, message % conflict_string)
argparse.ArgumentError: argument --force: conflicting option string: --force
```

I found this error when I mistakenly used a `-p` flag in front of the profiles to merge.

I technically discovered this error using anvi-5.5, but Alon got the same error when using anvi-master. Unfortunately though this means I don't have example files for you. :(

title: [SOLVED] Graphical server shuts down immediately after starting on macOS Catalina
body:
Hi there,
I installed anvio-6 as follows:
```
conda create -n anvio python=3.6
conda activate anvio
conda config --env --add channels conda-forge
conda config --env --add channels bioconda
conda install -y anvio=6
conda install -y diamond=0.9.14
```

title: Functional enrichment output includes negative enrichment_score
body:
The functional enrichment test sometimes outputs (very very small) negative enrichment scores.

For example in our pangenomic tutorial, we get this for many functions that occur in all members of both groups:

COG_FUNCTION | enrichment_score | unadjusted_p_value | adjusted_q_value | associated_groups | function_accession | gene_clusters_ids | p_LL | p_HL | N_LL | N_HL
-- | -- | -- | -- | -- | -- | -- | -- | -- | -- | --
Phosphoribosylaminoimidazole-succinocarboxamide   synthase | -7.34E-41 | 1 | 1 | NA | COG0152 | GC_00000085 | 1 | 1 | 11 | 20

It is obvious that this score should just be zero. I don't know why there's a negative result here, but we can just add some command to change anything below zero to zero (CC:ing @adw96 :-) I will add this step to your script, unless I hear any objections/suggestions from you).

title: anvi-compute-ani puts alignment coverage as 1 whenever percent identity is 0?
body:
This is a minor issue:
I used anvi-compute-ani with `--method ANIm`, and I notice that whenever the percent identity is 0 then the alignment coverage is 1. That doesn't make sense to me... I think if the percent identity is 0 then alignment coverage should also be 0.

title: missing annotations after  running anvi-gen-genomes-storage
body:
Hi folks,

I was trying to run a pangenomic analysis and I noticed something weird: the functional annotations from certain sources and genomes disappeared.

The pangenome contains 9 genomes, 3 from NCBI and 6 from metagenomes. But the later ones were exported into individual dbs. Therefore I included all of them as external genomes because there are no separated contig and profile dbs anymore.

All genomes except one of the derived from NCBI, were upgraded from version 8 contigs db to version 12. I tested it with anvio 5.1.0 and anvio 5.2.0, both under conda in Linux with the same results.


So,  `anvi-gen-genomes-storage` detects all the annotation sources in all genomes as I expected:

```bash
$ anvi-gen-genomes-storage -e genomes.tsv -o ANME2D-GENOMES.db

WARNING
===============================================
Good news! Anvi'o found all these functions that are common to all of your
genomes and will use them for downstream analyses and is very proud of you:
'InterPro, ProSitePatterns, TIGRFAM, Pfam, SUPERFAMILY, CDD, GO, Hamap,
ProSiteProfiles, PANTHER, SFLD, PRINTS, COG_FUNCTION, COG_CATEGORY, Gene3D,
PIRSF, SMART, ProDom'.

Internal genomes .............................: 0 have been initialized.                                                                                   
External genomes .............................: 9 found.                                                                                                   

PLEASE READ CAREFULLY
===============================================
Some of your genomes had gene calls identified by gene callers other than the
gene caller anvi'o used, which was set to 'prodigal' either by default, or
because you asked for it. The following genomes contained genes that were not
processed (this may be exactly what you expect to happen, but if was not, you
may need to use the `--gene-caller` flag to make sure anvi'o is using the gene
caller it should be using): Methanoperedens_ferrireducens (1 gene calls by
"Ribosomal_RNAs").

                                                                                                                                                           
* LFW_24 is stored with 3,234 genes (154 of which were partial)
* LFW_280_1_1 is stored with 2,033 genes (322 of which were partial)                                                                                       
* LFW_280_2_2 is stored with 2,534 genes (391 of which were partial)                                                                                       
* LFW_280_3_1 is stored with 3,546 genes (133 of which were partial)                                                                                       
* LFW_280_3_2 is stored with 2,983 genes (79 of which were partial)                                                                                        
* LFW_280_4 is stored with 2,917 genes (145 of which were partial)                                                                                         
* Methanoperedens_ferrireducens is stored with 2,988 genes (38 of which were partial)                                                                      
* Methanoperedens_nitroreducens is stored with 3,375 genes (9 of which were partial)                                                                       
* Methanoperedens_sp_BLZ1 is stored with 4,530 genes (599 of which were partial)                                                                           

The new genomes storage ......................: ANME2D-GENOMES.db (v6, signature: hashfe0c8ff1)
Number of genomes ............................: 9 (internal: 0, external: 9)
Number of gene calls .........................: 28,140
Number of partial gene calls .................: 1,870
```

However, if I look inside the genomes storage db, all my MAGs got stripped from any annotations aside of COG.

```
$ sqlite3 ANME2D-GENOMES.db -header
SQLite version 3.24.0 2018-06-04 19:24:41
Enter ".help" for usage hints.
sqlite> SELECT DISTINCT source from gene_function_calls WHERE genome_name = 'LFW_24';
source
COG_FUNCTION
COG_CATEGORY
sqlite> SELECT DISTINCT source from gene_function_calls WHERE genome_name = 'Methanoperedens_ferrireducens';
source
InterPro
SUPERFAMILY
GO
COG_FUNCTION
COG_CATEGORY
Gene3D
ProSiteProfiles
ProSitePatterns
TIGRFAM
Pfam
CDD
PANTHER
PRINTS
SFLD
SMART
ProDom
PIRSF
Hamap
```

On top of that, the `gene_callers_id` were resetted, i.e. they were re-numbered and they don't match the original `gene_callers_id` from their individual dbs:

```
$ sqlite3 ANME2D-GENOMES.db
sqlite> select max(gene_callers_id ) from gene_function_calls WHERE genome_name = 'LFW_24';
max(gene_callers_id )
3233

$ sqlite3 genomes/LFW_Bin_00024.db
sqlite> select max(gene_callers_id ) from gene_functions ;
max(gene_callers_id )
1363304
```

Any idea about what could be happening?

Cheers,
Xabi

title: Fix megahit rule
body:
This pull request includes critical fixes to the metagenomics workflow.

As of snakemake v5.2, you can no longer use directories as outputs, unless you specifically mark these as directories (see https://snakemake.readthedocs.io/en/stable/snakefiles/rules.html#directories-as-outputs).

This issue affected both the `megahit` and `idba_ud` rules (but nothing else).

Thank you @jarrodscott for reporting this issue.

title: SyntaxError for rule anvi_script_run_eggnog_mapper
body:
When running the contigs workflow (or any other workflow since they all depend on the contigs workflow), we get the following error (as of snakemake version v5)

```
SyntaxError:
Not all output, log and benchmark files of rule anvi_script_run_eggnog_mapper contain the same wildcards. This is crucial though, in order to avoid that two or more jobs write to the same file.
  File "/Users/alonshaiber/github/anvio/anvio/workflows/contigs/Snakefile", line 372, in <module>
```

Before version v5 of snakemake, they didn't check for this, and even though this was a bad design on my end (to have all instances of this rule writing to the same log file), it didn't cause any trouble.

This was fixed in fc9443772ac4ade552fde3ffb7cee4e239dde6ab
I'm opening this issue just for documentation purposes.

## Possible solutions (until we release a new stable release)

**If you are using anvio v5.1 and you are getting this error, then you probably have a version of snakemake that is not compatible with anvio 5.1. The version of snakemake that is compatible with anvio 5.1 is snakemake 4.7.**

In order to go around this people can either:
1. Make sure that they have the compatible version of snakemake (if you installed it with pip, then you can simply:
```
pip uninstall snakemake
pip install snakemake==4.7
```
2. Alternatively, they can switch to working with the latest (unstable) version of anvio following these instructions: http://merenlab.org/2016/06/26/installation-v2/#installing-or-updating-from-the-active-codebase-because-why-not.

title: anvi-get-sequences-for-hmm-hits fails to report HMM hits for internal genomes
body:
This is a critical bug that is associated with anvi'o `v5.1`.

When `anvi-get-sequences-for-hmm-hits`, which is [extensively described here](http://merenlab.org/2017/06/07/phylogenomics/) as a part of the anvi'o phylogenomics workflow, is used with **internal genomes**, the resulting FASTA file does not consider collection names for internal genomes.

When the user also uses `--concatenate` and `--return-best-hit` flags, the resulting FASTA file for a given bin contains genes that are best hits for a given gene name not only in the bin itself, but in the entire contigs database, likely resulting in critical mistakes in phylogenomic analyses.

title: anvi-import-collection error (entries are not unique in some tables)
body:
I'm running anvio version:

```
Anvi'o version ...............................: margaret (vunknown)
Profile DB version ...........................: 29
Contigs DB version ...........................: 12
Pan DB version ...............................: 12

Structure DB version .........................: 1
(/ebio/abt3_projects/software/dev/llmga/.snakemake/conda/3b8a2f3c)
```

...and I'm getting the following error when running `anvi-import-collection` on a set of bins generated with `maxbin2`:

```
Contig/split name conversion .................: 56166 contig names converted into 56166 split names.
Item names in input ..........................: 56,166
Num bins in input ............................: 190
Items in profile database ....................: 57,501
Item names shared between input and db .......: 56,166

WARNING
===============================================
1335 item(s) that were in the database, but were not in the input file, will not
be described by any bin in the collection MaxBin2_low_prob. That is totally
fine, but anvi'o hopes that you are aware of that. This means you have more
things in your database than the number of things your input file describes.
Here is an example of something that is in your database but not in any bin in
your input file: coassemble_26409_split_00001.



Config Error: This is one of the core functions of anvi'o you never want to hear from, but
              there seems to be something wrong with the table 'collections_bins_info' that
              you are trying to read from. While there are 516 items in this table, there are
              only 326 unique keys, which means some of them are going to be overwritten when
              this function creates a final dictionary of data to return. This may be a
              programmer error when the data was being inserted into the database, but needs
              fixin' before we can continue. If you are a user, please get in touch with
              anvi'o developers about this error. If you are a programmer, you probably did
              something wrong :(
```

For generating the contig db, I used the `--skip-mindful-splitting` option, since I had already split my contigs prior to the import. The `maxbin2` binning was done on the split contigs, so all of the contig naming should be the same. As far as I can tell, none of my contigs are named with "*_split_00001" in my contigs database or in my maxbin2 bins. 

For the `anvi-import-collection` command, I'm using `--contigs-mode`, which I thought prevented renaming of the contigs. However, the log for the import states: 

```
Contig/split name conversion .................: 56166 contig names converted into 56166 split names.
```

...so it appears that `anvi-import-collection` is renaming contigs labeled such as `coassemble_26409` to `coassemble_26409_split_00001`, which results in a key mismatch between the collection contig names and the database contigs names. Is this a bug with `anvi-import-collection --contigs-mode` or am I just doing something wrong? 

I can't find a lot of documentation on `--contigs-mode`, so it's hard to tell if I'm using it wrong. The docs on `anvi-import-collection` state:

```
  --contigs-mode        Use this flag if your binning was done on contigs
                        instead of splits. Please refer to the documentation
                        for help.
```

...but where in the `documentation` should I be looking? There's a ton of documentation on the anvio website, and I don't see any search bar for finding all docs relating to `--contigs-mode`. I could only find this info at http://merenlab.org/2016/06/22/anvio-tutorial-v2/:

> But if you have contig names, you can import them using anvi-import-collection with the flag --contigs-mode.

title: Critical anvi-migrate bug in anvi'o v5 affecting profile dbs v20 or earlier
body:
If your anvi'o profile database is `v20` or earlier, migrating it with `v5` will cause an issue (the issue is revertible, but very annoying).

Learn your database version the following way, and do not migrate unless it is `v20` or earlier:

```
(anvio-master) meren ~/github/anvio $ anvi-db-info ~/Downloads/TARA_ANW_MAG_00006/PROFILE.db

DB Info (no touch)
===============================================
Database Path ................................: /Users/meren/Downloads/TARA_ANW_MAG_00006/PROFILE.db
Description ..................................: _No description is provided_
Type .........................................: profile
Version ......................................: 20
```

We will address this bug first in `master`, and then with a minor stable release.

title: Import functions error in v4
body:
Joseph Nesme reported this, and provided test files on Slack. Here is his medal for that:🥇 

It seems the `TableForGeneFunctions` class fails to recover existing functional annotations form the database, which causes a poorly parsed function names to be re-added to the `self` table, which results in an output like this:

```
 $ anvi-export-functions -c contigs.db --list-annotation-sources

ANNOTATION SOURCES FOUND
===============================================
* P
* r
* S
* e
* L
* s
* D
* A
* COG_CATEGORY
* c
* g
* i
* t
* R
* C
* COG_FUNCTION
*
*
* _
* f
* o
```

this is basically due to this:

```
 $ sqlite3 contigs.db 'select * from self where key="gene_function_sources";'
gene_function_sources|G,I,CARDrgi_Loose,CARDrgi_Perfect,C,A,O,N,_,R,,,F,CARDrgi_Strict,Y,T,E,U
```

title: Unexpected behaviors for --size-for-MAG and --min-completion-for-MAG in anvi-rename-bins
body:
Hi,

I'm using Anvi'o ver. 3.  I experienced unexpected behaviors in the program, anvi-rename-bins.
I tried to define metagenomic bins with >70% completion and >2 Mbp in length as MAGs and rename the MAGs. However, some bins that satisfied this criterion did not get renamed as MAGs and other bins that did not satisfy this criterion were renamed as MAGs.

FYI, what I ran was;

$ anvi-rename-bins -c CONTIGS.db -p PROFILE.db --collection-to-read CONCOCT_c25 --collection-to-write FINAL --use-SCG-averages --call-MAGs --size-for-MAG 2 --min-completion-for-MAG 70 --max-redundancy-for-MAG 10 --prefix O_PUP --report-file FINAL.txt

Thank you.

Jun

title: Error in anvi-display-pan
body:
Hi Anvio team

I am performing some comparative genomics analysis (same workflow as #587) and having an issue with anvi-display-pan. I used the following code to perform the pangenomic analysis on my genomes (Yeah.. I am using the the pangenomic workflow to do comparative genomics on genomes that are not part of the same species or genus.. I don't know if this is something extremely inappropriate. Forgive me if it is and let me know if there is an alternative....:-\ )

```anvi-pan-genome -g MY-GENOMES.h5 -n "CompGenomics_PAOs" -T 5 --overwrite-output-destinations```

I got a lot of protein clusters (~59000), so anvio did not want to perform heirarchical clustering on it (understandably).

Then I used the following line of code to display the analysis 
```anvi-display-pan -p CompGenomics_PAOs-PAN.db -s SAMPLES.db -g CompGenomics_PAOs-PAN-GENOMES.h5```

and I got this error:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):

    d = interactive.Interactive(args)

    self.load_pan_mode()

I am guessing this is related to the lack of heirarchical clustering.

title: anvi-merge error v3: KeyError: 'total_length'
body:
We've been hearing about the following merge error from some of our users, but we have not been able to reproduce it:

```
File "/sw/csi/anvio/3.0.0/el7_py361_anacondaenv/env/bin/anvi-merge", line 50, in <module>
merger.MultipleRuns(args).merge()
File "/sw/csi/anvio/3.0.0/el7_py361_anacondaenv/env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/anvio/merger.py", line 284, in merge
self.sanity_check()
File "/sw/csi/anvio/3.0.0/el7_py361_anacondaenv/env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/anvio/merger.py", line 160, in sanity_check
v = set([r[k] for r in list(self.profile_dbs_info_dict.values())])
File "/sw/csi/anvio/3.0.0/el7_py361_anacondaenv/env/lib/python3.5/site-packages/anvio/merger.py", line 160, in <listcomp>
v = set([r[k] for r in list(self.profile_dbs_info_dict.values())])
KeyError: 'total_length'
```

The error is likely due to trying to merge profile databases generated by an older version of anvi'o with the latest `v3` version. Usually we keep track of database changes very carefully, and we do not force our users to re-profile their data, but here we are the first time after more than a year.

Is this happening to you? **Please help us better understand the problem by answering these questions**, and we will provide you with a script that will fix your profile databases:

* Do you remember which version of anvi'o did you generate your profile databases you are trying to merge?

* Can you please run this command on one of your anvi'o profile databases you are merging and include the output to your response: `sqlite3 PATH/TO/PROFILE.db 'select * from self;'`

title: All bins from collection load automatically with empty set of splits when using anvi-refine
body: So, this seems to be a systematic problem with anvi-refine on the anvi'o master: all bins from the collection load with empty set of splits when refining a bin of interest (usually only the invoked bin will load). As a result, we have to remove all bins manually before we can save the refinement efforts. This is rapidly impossible to manage as the number of bins increases.... . Here is a link to a test project if needed: https://www.dropbox.com/s/945kk4il9e5us4o/Archive.zip?dl=0 and the command line I used: ``` anvi-refine -c Abe_2500nt_CONTIGS.db -p PROFILE.db -C default -b Bin_1 ``` Thanks for looking into this, Tom

title: "Share project" issue
body:
To test the "share project" functionality I sent two commits (cdc48db644753f7e667e22bcf75039958ce9a6b4 and d01cce16f3d297fd5b356eacf3565171b7bfde45), and now I can click share without getting any unexpected error. But this time I get another one, so I thought I should report this as a new issue :) Sorry for the SPAM.

This is what I did; run `./run_server_test.sh mock`, login as `meren` / `test`, click share project for m_proj_01, type in a name:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/197307/12100307/cab93360-b2f3-11e5-85a7-1e7689b8973b.png)

share project failed
view name already taken

share project failed

title: anvi-profile -i BAM_FILE.bam --list-contigs no longer works with v1.1.0
body:
Linda reported that with anvi'o v1.1.0, running this command gives an error:

``` bash
$ anvi-profile -i 204_3contigs_6M.bam --list-contigs
usage: anvi-profile [-h] [-i INPUT_BAM] -c CONTIGS_DB [-d PROFILE]
                    [--cluster-contigs] [-o DIR_PATH] [-W] [-S NAME]
                    [--report-variability-full] [-M INT] [-X INT] [-V INT]
                    [--list-contigs] [--contigs-of-interest FILE]
anvi-profile: error: argument -c/--contigs-db is required
```

A contigs database is not required for this operation, yet while I updated the interfaces for command line tools I must have missed that.

I will fix this in the repository, but it will not be available until v1.1.1.

I apologize for the inconvenience.

title: saving an empty refined bin by mistake might create a bug
body:
Hi,
very specific bug,
I was working on refining a bin, and by mistake clicked to save the group without selecting any split. It said "bin was successfully saved". Then of course I selected all wanted bins and clicked again to save the good selection. This time the saving did not work. I tried multiple times, and also by changing the group name, without any success.
I moved on and summarized my work, but now I simply "lost" this genome from my collection...

Tom

title: HMMER version issues.
body:
Here is another bug reported by @rikander.

If the HMMER version is not compatible with the HMM databases on the system, the entire HMM search process fails like this:

```
HMM Profiling for example_hmm_dir
===============================================
Reference ....................................: Anvio et al, http://merenlab.org/projects/anvio
Pfam model ...................................: example_hmm_dir/genes.hmm.gz
Number of genes ..............................: 2
Temporary work dir ...........................: /var/folders/k4/mhw6hksd3qzdx0p0k29g26mw0000gp/T/tmph9KMdK
HMM scan output ..............................: /var/folders/k4/mhw6hksd3qzdx0p0k29g26mw0000gp/T/tmph9KMdK/hmm.output
HMM scan hits ................................: /var/folders/k4/mhw6hksd3qzdx0p0k29g26mw0000gp/T/tmph9KMdK/hmm.hits
Log file .....................................: /var/folders/k4/mhw6hksd3qzdx0p0k29g26mw0000gp/T/tmph9KMdK/00_log.txt
Traceback (most recent call last):                                                                                                                                                                          
  File "/usr/local/bin/anvi-populate-search-table", line 4, in <module>
    __import__('pkg_resources').run_script('anvio==0.9.1', 'anvi-populate-search-table')
  File "build/bdist.macosx-10.10-x86_64/egg/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 696, in run_script
  File "build/bdist.macosx-10.10-x86_64/egg/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 1614, in run_script
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/anvio-0.9.1-py2.7-macosx-10.10-x86_64.egg/EGG-INFO/scripts/anvi-populate-search-table", line 72, in <module>
    main(args)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/anvio-0.9.1-py2.7-macosx-10.10-x86_64.egg/EGG-INFO/scripts/anvi-populate-search-table", line 51, in main
    search_tables.populate_search_tables(sources)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/anvio-0.9.1-py2.7-macosx-10.10-x86_64.egg/anvio/dbops.py", line 835, in populate_search_tables
    reference)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/anvio-0.9.1-py2.7-macosx-10.10-x86_64.egg/anvio/commandline.py", line 114, in run_hmmscan
    for line in open(self.hmm_scan_hits_shitty).readlines():
IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/folders/k4/mhw6hksd3qzdx0p0k29g26mw0000gp/T/tmph9KMdK/hmm.hits.shitty'
```

The reason to why we can't find hmm.hits.shitty file is hidden in the log file:

```
CMD: hmmpress "/var/folders/k4/mhw6hksd3qzdx0p0k29g26mw0000gp/T/tmph9KMdK/hmm.txt" >> "/var/folders/k4/mhw6hksd3qzdx0p0k29g26mw0000gp/T/tmph9KMdK/00_log.txt" 2>&1

Error: File /var/folders/k4/mhw6hksd3qzdx0p0k29g26mw0000gp/T/tmph9KMdK/hmm.txt does not appear to be in a recognized HMM format.

CMD: hmmscan -o "/var/folders/k4/mhw6hksd3qzdx0p0k29g26mw0000gp/T/tmph9KMdK/hmm.output" --cut_ga --tblout "/var/folders/k4/mhw6hksd3qzdx0p0k29g26mw0000gp/T/tmph9KMdK/hmm.hits.shitty" "/var/folders/k4/mhw6hksd3qzdx0p0k29g26mw0000gp/T/tmph9KMdK/hmm.txt" "/var/folders/k4/mhw6hksd3qzdx0p0k29g26mw0000gp/T/tmpcevoYI/contigs.proteins" >> "/var/folders/k4/mhw6hksd3qzdx0p0k29g26mw0000gp/T/tmph9KMdK/00_log.txt" 2>&1

Error: Unrecognized format, trying to open hmm file /var/folders/k4/mhw6hksd3qzdx0p0k29g26mw0000gp/T/tmph9KMdK/hmm.txt for reading.
```

So if there is an HMM database, format of which is not recognized by the currently installed version of HMMER, we fail.

Solution: check for that missing file, and if its not there, urge the user to install the newest version of HMMER.

title: Saved state + additional metadata
body:
Hi Özcan,

I just run into a bug that I wanted to write about. I haven't looked into the code, so please feel free to WONTFIX it if it is too complicated.

You can reproduce the bug like this:

```
$ cd tests/mini_test/test-output
$ anvi-interactive -p 204-MERGED/PROFILE.db -a ANNOTATION.db
```

save the state from the interface. kill the server, then run this:

```
$ anvi-interactive -p 204-MERGED/PROFILE.db -a ANNOTATION.db --state 204-MERGED/SAVED_STATE
```

runs perfectly. kill the server, then run this:

```
$ anvi-interactive -p 204-MERGED/PROFILE.db -a ANNOTATION.db -A anvio_concoct_clusters.txt
```

runs perfectly. kill the server, then run this:

```
$ anvi-interactive -p 204-MERGED/PROFILE.db -a ANNOTATION.db -A anvio_concoct_clusters.txt --state 204-MERGED/SAVED_STATE
```

treelib.js dies (because it finds the layer, but it is `undefined`, for obvious reasons).

Of course now there is an extra layer that was not in the state file. The other way around is possible too. I mean, you may run the interface first with a layer of additional metadata, save the state, and now you can't use that state without using the additional metadata again.

I have no suggestions, just wanted to let you know and see where would you like to go with this :) As I said, WONTFIX is an option, too (in that case I would write a small check to show an error message that says "your state file says X layers, you have just given me Y, that state is garbage yo").

Best,

              metadata agrees with the tree, the tree does not agree with the database, the
              database does not agree with the metadata; HTH!).

I ran with the flag and the tree failed to load the tnf clustered tree.

title: ColumnProfile issue
body:
Dear Faruk, There are two sections in this report. You can find all the files I used to describe the first part here in this archive: https://www.dropbox.com/s/6qtcwg6g9gmix58/cp_test.tar.gz # Part 1 I profiled the BAM file you will find in that archive first using the Python module, and then using the the C module to measure the runtime. First, I made the C module _unavailable_ (hehe): 
$ mv /groups/merenlab/anvio/anvio/columnprofile.so /groups/merenlab/anvio/anvio/__columnprofile.so
Here is the command for profiling (as you can see it falls back to the Python module): 
$ time anvi-profile -i Day-17b.bam -a INFANT-GUT-ANNOTATION.db --contigs e_f_contigs.txt -o python_profile
* C extension for ColumnProfile failed to load, falling back to the Python
implementation...

[... stripped ...]

real    1m45.932s
user    1m44.168s
sys 0m0.602s
1 minutes and 45 seconds. OK. _Activating_ the C module: 
$ mv /groups/merenlab/anvio/anvio/__columnprofile.so /groups/merenlab/anvio/anvio/columnprofile.so
And running the same command (note that the output directory is different): 
$ time anvi-profile -i Day-17b.bam -a INFANT-GUT-ANNOTATION.db --contigs e_f_contigs.txt -o c_profile

[... stripped ...]

real    1m50.641s
user    1m45.775s
sys 0m3.436s
With the C module, it is 1 minute and 50 seconds. This is weird. We do expect to see an improvement... Why is this the case? Our hint is in the database. `variable_positions` tables are being populated by the column profile results. Look at the number of entries in each: 
$ sqlite3 c_profile/PROFILE.db 'select count(*) from variable_positions;'
54184
$ sqlite3 python_profile/PROFILE.db 'select count(*) from variable_positions;'
11
54184 positions reported by C module versus 11 positions reported by Python?! Part 2 will clarify why is this happening. _(you can always use this BAM file to benchmark the performance of your code)_ # Part 2 I implemented a test script, `test_column_profile.py`, which is now under the [tests](https://github.com/meren/anvio/tree/master/tests) directory. When you run it, it will give you some useful outputs, and you can increase the number of tests in the code to get a broader sense. When you don't use the test_class, this is what happens: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/197307/7334846/e496e046-eb6d-11e4-8390-652a05f0fb0e.png) The results are -almost- identical, and C is about 38 times faster on a single column. When you don't use the test_class, things go wrong, though: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/197307/7334839/b5e9bd04-eb6d-11e4-9115-c9804ca35e2a.png) As you can see, although C is still fast, the reports for that particular column differs. Because the C code does not use the test_class properly, therefore returns an n2n1ratio for every column, when a large fraction of them should fail. That's why we end up with 50,000+ positions instead of 11 for the example BAM file. This makes other parts of the process much slower, which is why -I hope- we get such similar run times on the same file. I hope this is clear/helpful. Thanks,

body: related to #78.

title: pileup has a default max cutoff at 8,000X
body: The way to change it is to set `max_depth` to a much larger number in `pileup()`.

title: if there is no clustering (tree data) available, anvi'o should still be able to visualize
body:
Fixing #68 made two new params available. However, currently PaPi is unable to visualize runs _unless_ papi-profile was run _with_ `--cluster-contigs`, and papi-merge was run _without_ `--skip-clustering`.

So if you do this:

```
cd tests/mini_test/test-output
papi-profile -i 204-7M.bam -o 204-7M -a ANNOTATION.db
papi-interactive -r 204-7M/RUNINFO.cp -a ANNOTATION.db
```

you will get this error:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/meren/Desktop/MBL/PaPi/bin/papi-interactive", line 88, in <module>
    d = interactive.InputHandler(parser.parse_args())
  File "/Users/meren/Desktop/MBL/PaPi/PaPi/interactive.py", line 82, in __init__
    tree = Tree(self.runinfo['clusterings'][self.runinfo['default_clustering']]['newick'])
KeyError: 'default_clustering'
```

Likewise, you will get the same error if you do this:

```
cd tests/mini_test/test-output/
papi-merge 204*/RUNINFO.cp -o test-output/204-MERGED --skip-clustering
papi-interactive -r 204-MERGED/RUNINFO.mcp -a ANNOTATION.db
```

PaPi should be able to operate if there is no clustering available. For instance, instead of a tree, it can show contigs ordered by name (or based on a user-provided order).

title: float division by zero in get_relative_abundance_of_split

title: Contigs <-> Annotation DB
body:
Each annotation database should keep the sha1sum of the FASTA file that is generated from. Right now it is possible to generate an annotation table, then populate it with search results coming from a totally different FASTA file.

This mistake should not be possible to make.
